name: podamShouldHandleIntegerValues

testSteps.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.IntegerValuePojo

Then the object IntegerRangeValuesPojo ( intFieldWithMinValueOnly = 1    intFieldWithPreciseValue = 145241    intFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 98    intFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 479    integerObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 1    integerObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 26    integerObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 224    integerObjectFieldWithPreciseValue = 145241     ) should not be null
Then the integer field should be greater or equal to zero
Then the integer field 98 should have a value not greater than 100
Then the integer field 479 should have a value between 1 and 1000
Then the pojo 1 must be of the type class java.lang.Integer
Then the integer field should be greater or equal to zero
Then the pojo 26 must be of the type class java.lang.Integer
Then the integer field 26 should have a value not greater than 100
Then the pojo 224 must be of the type class java.lang.Integer
Then the integer field 224 should have a value between 1 and 1000
Then the integer field 145241 should have the precise value of 145241
Then the pojo 145241 must be of the type class java.lang.Integer
Then the integer field 145241 should have the precise value of 145241

title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped integer values with @PodamIntValue annotation
